newsitem.title: UK: Liam Gallagher pulls out of Oasis's U.S. tour.
newsitem.headline: Liam Gallagher pulls out of Oasis's U.S. tour.

text.p: Liam Gallagher, the lead singer with British rock superstars Oasis, pulled out of the group's U.S. tour at the last minute on Monday -- to go house-hunting.
Gallagher, 23, refused to board a plane at London's Heathrow airport shortly before the chart-topping band was due to leave for Chicago at the start of a three-week tour.
Speaking later outside the house he shares in the plush St John's Wood district of London with actress Patsy Kensit, Gallagher said he urgently needed to hunt for a new home.

"The house has just been sold and I'm having moving problems. We have go to be out by the weekend. I am not going around touring in the U.S. when I've got nowhere to live," he told reporters, according to British newspaper reports.
Gallagher said he might fly out later to join Oasis, who have been described as the Beatles of the nineties.
In the meantime Liam's brother, guitarist Noel, will sing in his place. The two have had a frequently fiery relationship.

"The band are going to try to do it without me. If they can't do it I guess I'll go back. I don't care about the tour. I am sick of living my life in hotels. I need to be happy. I've got to find a place to live," Liam was quoted as saying.
It was the second time in days the temperamental star had let down his fans.
On Friday Gallagher failed to appear on stage when Oasis performed for 400 select fans at London's Royal Festival Hall.
Instead, he watched the show from a private box, pleading a sore throat.
A spokesman for Oasis's record company, Creation Records, said Gallagher had no intention of quitting the band.
